task.title: Creating Ticket Types
task.abstract: Ticket types identify the available options of admittance to an event. Staff users can set Early Bird and On-site pricing, restrict the number of tickets available for sale, and establish which attendees can purchase specific tickets. All events must have at least one associated ticket type. Additionally, best practices recommend that ticket types be created within the Event Category or within the Event.

ul.li: If required, Set up Deferred Revenue

step.cmd: Navigate to the Ticket Types related list and click the New Ticket Type button.
Enter the Item Name, Unit of Measure, and Price fields.
step.info: The Price field can have a value of "0" or a value greater than "0."

step.cmd: Enter the Image URL and Description.
step.info: The Image URL and Description displays on the Event Registration page in the Community Portal.
Ensure the ticket type is linked to the associated Event or Event Category via the lookups. The Event Category will autopopulate if the ticket type is created directly from the Event Category record.

choices.choice: Enable Access Permissions - Restricts which attendees can purchase a ticket type. Additionally, if enabled, click the Manage Permissions button on the Access Permissions related list. Access Permissions are available to authenticated users only.

Attach a form to the ticket type through the Ticket Type Form lookup. When a user selects a ticket type in the Community Portal that has a form attachment, the user is required to complete the form in order to complete registration.

step.cmd: Check the Is Published checkbox and click Save.
step.info: The Is Active checkbox is enabled based on the Event Category record. When the Is Active checkbox is checked on the Ticket Type record, the ticket can be purchased by Admins and staff users through the backend Shopping Cart. Community Portal users can only purchase the ticket if the Is Published checkbox is enabled.

taskbody.result: The ticket type is created and the system will generate a related Item record and it's price rules.If schedule items are enabled for a Conference event, creating a new ticket type will also create a package item.
